content.question: Which of the following best describes a cell that is in the <math alttext="G 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> stage of the cell cycle?

choices.label: The cell is growing in size and increasing its number of proteins and organelles.
The chromosomes within the cell are checked to make certain that they have been replicated correctly.
The chromosomes are replicating, and the amount of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>DNA</mtext></math> in the cell is doubling.
The cell is in a resting stage and no longer dividing.

content.answer: The cell is growing in size and increasing its number of proteins and organelles.
